channel.title: Merica (We the people)
channel.description:
States who dislike Obama are trying to secede.
INDIANAPOLIS - Following the outcome of the Nov. 6 election, a group of Hoosiers is petitioning to secede from the United States. Indiana is one of 22 states where residents are forming petitions to withdraw from the U.S. and from their own government. The "We the People" group cites a clause of the Declaration of Independence in its movement that states "whenever the government derives from the powers of the people, it is the right of the people to alter or abolish it and institute a new government." Petitions have been filed for Alabama, Arkansas, Colorado, Florida, Georgia, Indiana, Kentucky, Louisiana, Michigan, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, North Dakota, Oregon, South Carolina, Tennessee, and Texas. Among the 22 states in the secede petition, 17 of them voted for Republican presidential candidate Mitt Romney.
If you want to learn more, I suggest you research the topic. Discuss. [b]Source:[/b] http://www.wptv.com/dpp/news/national/secession-petitions-we-the-people-group-petitioning-to-secede-from-the-us-sparks-controversy

item.title: Merica (We the people)
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:32, topic:468745”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=585730.msg4160559#msg4160559 date=1353046481]
If they want to leave and it passes congress, which i doubt, it will be for the better of the country. All the sourthern states wanting to recede are the main areas where we get the money moochers living off disability who aren’t really disabeled. Will probably save us in the billions.
[/quote]
The left-states are the welfare whores. Did you smoke week in your government classes?[/quote]

“left-states” is a badly defined term, political affiliation of a state changes (quite dramatically) each election and if you actually look at percentages of voter turnouts by state you will see that there aren’t any left states in the same sense that there aren’t any black, or white states

but given that welfare demographics don’t include political affiliation, and quite frankly shouldn’t, the whole idea that democrats are welfare whores is completely unfounded

Read full topic

item.title: Merica (We the people)
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

I attend school over the internet. May I not know if its left winged or right winged, I don’t know. I assume its neutral as it is a SCHOOL. Even if you attend a private religious school, they should still teach you the morals on which this country was founded on and the government. A government class would totally change your understanding on how this country is ran.

You have no fucking right to tell me that I am a pussy because I am telling you to educate yourself. Some of my views may be left wing, but you have not educational background in government so you have no base to argue on minus what the nuns at your school taught you.

Read full topic

item.title: Merica (We the people)
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I would just LOVE to take a government class in my school, you don’t even know my background. Again, with the same comebacks over, and over again. Get some REAL fucking facts to go against me, every time I say something your reply is something like “u so dum u ned gerverment clazzes”, yet you’ve never once directly attack what I’ve tried to say, and you ALWAYS pussy out to everyone else’s replies, because you don’t know what grade they are in and you can’t use that comeback.

@The whole government class idea: Me going to a Christian private school, is going to be severely right-winged anyways, whatever unionized public school you go to is going to be left-winged. So that whole argument is pretty irrelevant.

Read full topic

item.title: Merica (We the people)
item.dc:creator: @F_A_I_L_S Fails
item.description:
@F_A_I_L_S wrote:

Adding on to David’s first comment; In order for a state to secede, it must gain 25,000 supporters in order to get a response from the Obama administration. Even then, he has the right to ‘reject’ them. (The states he won)

Read full topic

item.title: Merica (We the people)
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

[quote=“tyb97, post:32, topic:468745”][quote author=RiiPiiNFtW link=topic=585730.msg4160559#msg4160559 date=1353046481]
If they want to leave and it passes congress, which i doubt, it will be for the better of the country. All the sourthern states wanting to recede are the main areas where we get the money moochers living off disability who aren’t really disabeled. Will probably save us in the billions.
[/quote]
The left-states are the welfare whores. Did you smoke week in your government classes?[/quote]You got to be kidding me? What left states? You mean the western states? California makes 8% + of the US income alone. They have agriculture, fishing, farming, tourist destinations, etc. Oregon and Washington are all the above aswell. Nevada is more Tourist destination then anything. Idaho provides all the potatoes and corn. Montana and Wyoming are the livestock providers, and I know because I used to live there. Utah really does nothing that I know of, but I assume they have a percentage of agriculture and livestock aswell. Colorado is everything above too. All the four corners states, including where I live New Mexico, are on what we call a basin. This basin is home to 80% of the country’s fossil fuels, coal, like 5% of the oil. All the states do out there is wrestle gators, chew on their grass, and grow corn.\

Southern states, and states with the Appalachians, have the moochers. I am not saying that every state has moochers because I know moochers here in my state aswell, but the MAJORITY of the moochers are in the area. Please don’t argue Tyb.

Read full topic
